---

## GAD-7 vs SF-36

Software Comparing the GAD-7 and SF-36 questionnaires can provide powerful insights into mental health, social functioning, and the impact of emotional problems on daily life. However, executing these comparisons manually could be a burdensome and inefficient process. A more practical and time-saving approach would be to use the Harmony software for GAD-7 vs SF-36 comparisons. Harmony is designed to facilitate exactly this kind of task, making use of advanced natural language processing and generative AI models to align comparable items within different questionnaires. When considering the GAD-7 vs SF-36 comparison, Harmony can itemise the respective components of each questionnaire and output a percentage match for each corresponding item. This evaluation can even be done in multiple languages, expanding the range of potential studies and datasets to evaluate. By choosing to use Harmony for GAD-7 vs SF-36 harmonisation, researchers can save valuable time and achieve more consistent results. Harmony's convenient drag-and-drop interface simplifies the process further; users can readily upload their own PDF questionnaires, or choose from those already available within Harmony's internal database. Make the most of your mental health and emotional wellbeing research with Harmony's intuitive GAD-7 vs SF-36 harmonisation capabilities.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
